Hi Jeff

What do you feed into the CPNN if not geometric information?  The =
CPNN
is used to exploit the geometric information in HyperNeat, but if this=

is not relevant to a domain, such as stock trading, how do you get it
to e=
ncode the substrate in a meaningful way? 

Be great to further this discuss=
ion.

Cheers

Matt

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Jeff Clune <jclune@...> wr=
ote:
>
> There are other benefits to HyperNEAT that have nothing to do with=

geometry,
> no? It is an indirect encoding, and thus is more likely to cre=
ate
modular
> phenotypes that exhibit repetitions and symmetry (with and wi=
thout
> variation).
> 
> Unless I am mistaken, these benefits can cause Hyp=
erNEAT to
outperform NEAT
> even on problems where geometry is not being ex=
ploited. Does that sound
> right to everyone?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Cheers,
> Je=
ff Clune
> 
> Digital Evolution Lab, Michigan State University
